IMPORTANT NOTE: Contacts Journal is now a free, universal app (with limits on data entry) that works on both iPhone and iPad, with an option to unlock an Unlimited Plan from within the app. The iPad-only version, and the Lite version, have been discontinued.

If you purchased the iPhone app before version 4.2, the app should automatically be unlocked with the Unlimited Plan when you update. The iPhone version will also now work on the iPad as well, for free!

If you purchased the iPad app before version 4.2: you should update the iPad app to the latest version, and then download this combined version onto your iPad. Your data should automatically be transferred into the new app when you open it, and you will be able to unlock the Unlimited Plan for free!

Introducing Contacts Journal For Teams!
- Share your Contacts Journal data with your colleagues, using your iCloud accounts
- Real-time, automatic syncing between multiple users
- Create multiple teams to share different information with different users
- Works across iPhone, iPad and Mac

Contacts Journal For Teams requires a monthly or annual subscription that is purchased through the app:
- Only the team creator needs to purchase a subscription; team participants can join a team for free
- 2-Weeks Free Trial on all plans
- contact us for more details at support@zaal-llc.com

Also New:
- Support for Siri Shortcuts in iOS12: now you can create a new Log or ToDo, or bring up the contacts search page, while using Siri.

If you need any help, please contact us at support@zaal-llc.com

We have an amazing update to start 2019 with! Our new "Create Contacts" page is elegantly designed to make you even more efficient while using Contacts Journal. Now, from the "Create Contact" page, you can:
• fill in basic contacts information very quickly, with less taps than the standard "Create Contact" page
• assign a contact to Public or Private Groups
• setup custom User Fields data; if you have Favorite fields, the default values are already filled in!
• create ToDos for important follow-ups

This will make setting up new contacts a breeze, and you'll be more productive than ever!

Other highlights:
• you can use Siri to bring up the Create Contacts page! See details on our support website
• you can use 'current location' when adding a new address, to fill-in the information automatically
• Custom Fields that are 'Favorite' will show up pre-filled with their default values
• works for both "Create Contact" and "Create Private Contact" options

Please note that you can switch back to the old "Create Contacts" page if you wish. You change this in More -> Settings -> Create Contact Settings page.

Other Updates:
• You can now setup a default value for Alerts in ToDos. To do this, go to the More -> Settings -> ToDo Settings page.
• v4.6.1 fixes issue with Siri shortcut not working correctly in some cases


If you run into any issues or have any questions, please email us at support@zaal-llc.com.

If you enjoy the updates, please support us by leaving a review in the App Store and recommending us to your friends and colleagues. Each review and referral matters, and helps us grow and improve our app.

Now compatible with the new iPad Pro!
Now compatible with the new iPad Pro!

[NEW] Text Formatting Options
- you can now bold, italics or underline text in the notes field for a Log or Todo, to make your text stand out.
- you can also combine multiple formatting options on the same selected text
- works across both iOS and Mac app

[NEW] "Recently Added Contacts"
- new filter to see contacts that were imported or created recently, within the last 7 days
- contacts list sorted by added date, making it easier to highlight the most recent contacts

Please Note: make sure you have updated all your Contacts Journal apps (on iPhone, iPad or Mac) to the latest version if you want to use Text Formatting options. Using an older Contacts Journal version can cause data inconsistencies and/or crashes if you sync it with the latest version of Contacts Journal.

If you run into any issues or have any questions, please email us at support@zaal-llc.com.

[NEW in 4.6.2]:
- New setting for the Default Tab to open for each contact. If you always want to open the Info tab when you select a contact, you can now do that!
- The 'New Contacts Detected' alert now has a "Quick Import" button, so you can import the new contacts with one button. This should enable you to seamlessly keep your contacts list in sync with the Contacts app.
- We made some other visual tweaks.

[NEW IN 4.6]:
- The "Create Contacts" page has been re-designed to be much more powerful and efficient!

When creating a new contact, you can now:
• fill in basic contacts information very quickly, with less taps than the standard "Create Contact" page
• assign a contact to Public or Private Groups
• setup custom User Fields data ... if you have Favorite fields, the default values are already filled in!
• create ToDos for important follow-ups
• use 'current location' to fill-in the address information automatically

This will make setting up new contacts a breeze, and should make you even more efficient while using Contacts Journal!

Other Updates:
• You can now setup a default Alerts value for ToDos. To do this, go to the More -> Settings -> ToDo Settings page.


If you enjoy the updates, please support us by leaving a review in the App Store (or updating your existing review), and recommending us to your friends and colleagues. Each review and referral matters, and helps us grow and improve our app.

[NEW IN 4.6]:
- The "Create Contacts" page has been re-designed to be much more powerful and efficient!

When creating a new contact, you can now:
• fill in basic contacts information very quickly, with less taps than the standard "Create Contact" page
• assign a contact to Public or Private Groups
• setup custom User Fields data ... if you have Favorite fields, the default values are already filled in!
• create ToDos for important follow-ups
• use 'current location' to fill-in the address information automatically

This will make setting up new contacts a breeze, and should make you even more efficient while using Contacts Journal!

[v5.0] This is a major update to Contacts Journal functionality, that should enable really powerful workflows. You can now add more details with every Log, capture Logs and Files from different apps, and use Group Emails to automate email blasts to your customers. Hope you like it!

** ADD LOGS PAGE REDESIGN **
- Add Logs now supports multiple contacts per Log
- Add Logs now supports images and file attachments in a Log
- Redesigned Add Logs and Add ToDo page

** GROUP EMAILS **
- Redesigned Email Drafts page allows you to send emails to multiple contacts at once. You can also send an email to a whole Contact Group!
- Also supports Email Templates, so you can apply a template to your Group Email, and the app will generate each email separately with the appropriate merge tags filled in.

** SHARE EXTENSIONS **
- Select text, images or files from any other app (including Mail, Photos, Safari, and any 3rd party app), and ‘share’ it with Contacts Journal, without having to leave the app
- New options "Add Log" and "Add File" will show up in the "Share" options, to easily add data and tag the appropriate contact

Please update your Contacts Journal apps, on iPhone, iPad and Mac, to the latest version if you use the new functionality.

If you run into any issues or have any questions, please email us at support@zaal-llc.com.

If you enjoy the updates, please support us by leaving a review in the App Store and recommending us to your friends and colleagues. Each review and referral matters, and helps us grow and improve our app.

[NEW] Maps Improvements:
* New pin styles on Maps page give contact's name and company name directly on the map, so you don't have to tap on each pin to find the contact. 
* With a contact's pin selected, you can now use Add Log or Add ToDo from that location!
* Maps Clustering groups together close-by pins into one, so that the Maps page loads very efficiently. You can zoom in and out, and the clustering will re-arrange automatically
* Note: if you want, you can turn off Clustering from More -> Settings -> Display Settings -> Maps Clustering.

[NEW] Contact Addresses in Logs / ToDo Location :
* You can now use a contact's address as the Location in a Log or ToDo. This will make it easier to add location information to your data.
* Previously you had to manually create a Location field, usually by duplicating a contact's address. With this update, you'll have a more efficient workflow.

[NEW] Contacts Search And Sort Improvements:
* Search on Contacts page is faster and more comprehensive.
* On Mac, search on the contacts page now includes emails and phone numbers.
* Sorting of contacts has also improved, and takes into account localized characters (e.g. previously names with umlauts used to grouped into the # section; now they should be sorted in the correct sections)

Please Note: make sure you have updated all your Contacts Journal apps (on iPhone, iPad or Mac) to the latest version if you want to use the latest functionality.

This update supports many great new features for iOS13:

DARK MODE 
• Contacts Journal now looks great in the system Dark Mode! Work automatically with your system settings.

SCAN DOCUMENTS
• scan documents from a contact's Files section, and save them into a PDF file!

ADD DRAWINGS
• add sketches, hand-written notes and drawings to a contact's Files section

CONTEXT MENU PREVIEWS
• long-press on a Log, ToDo, Files or Contact, and the item will now expand into 'Preview' mode, along with a context menu for 'actions'
• makes it much easier to scan through a large list of items without having to tap in-and-out of each page

SIRI SHORTCUTS
• Extensive support for Siri Shortcuts in iOS13. This will allow you to do things like adding a Log to a contact entirely from within Siri!
You can do the following activities using Siri Shortcuts:
- Add Logs and ToDos, including providing the title, location and note
- Add Contacts, including providing name, email, phone, address and the notes field
- View Logs and ToDos, including filtered by a particular contact, and by date ranges
- Find Contacts, using name, email, phone number or an address

MAP OPTIONS
• You can now customize the Map View to better suit your needs, and even go back to the old Map style from before v5.1
• Map Styles: now supports different map styles: Muted, Standard, Satellite, and Hybrid
• Map Options: you can hide contact names from showing up on the Map, and also turn off 'Map Pin Clustering'


If you enjoy the updates, please support us by leaving a review in the App Store and recommending us to your friends and colleagues. Each review and referral matters, and helps us grow and improve our app.

- In the notes field for Logs and ToDos, the app automatically detects links for websites, emails and phone numbers, and makes them clickable. Perfect for storing Zoom meeting links!

GROUP TEXT:
- You can now send a text message to multiple selected contacts, or to a whole group.

EMAIL TEMPLATES:
- You can now add Files to an Email Template, and they get added as email attachments when the template is invoked.
- You can also add merge-tags for a contact's website.

- You can now add Custom Fields to contacts more quickly, with fewer clicks.

[NEW] Powerful new filtering options!
- Filter Contacts list by multiple tags or groups!
- Filter Map view by different Pin Colors
- Filter overall Logs or ToDos list by multiple dates, and/or titles.

Bonus: you can also edit, rename and delete Tags, Private Groups, Titles, and Pin Colors from the new filter pages!

The changes in Contacts Journal v5.5 are focused on making your data more easily available and filterable, so that you can find the exact piece of data that you are looking for. This will make Contacts Journal more powerful to use, especially as you keep adding more information into the app.

- You can now add widgets from Contacts Journal to your home screen! We have 2 different types of widgets: 1) use the “Upcoming ToDos” widget to quickly glance at your upcoming tasks; 2) use “Nearby Contacts” to view contacts around your current location!

- New graphical date picker lets you quickly a select date and time for your Logs and ToDos

- You can now import multiple photos (and videos) at a time from your Photo Library
